abstract: Although the Texas water code exempts oil and gas drilling from some rules enacted by groundwater districts, they will apply to fracking nonetheless, some local officials decide.
snippet: Although the Texas water code exempts oil and gas drilling from some rules enacted by groundwater districts, they will apply to fracking nonetheless, some local officials decide.
lead_paragraph: The long drought in Texas is prompting some local districts to impose limits on water consumption for drillers that extract natural gas through hydraulic fracturing. While so far this has not affected gas production over all, it suggests a big policy shift in a state that has exempted oil and gas companies from many pumping restrictions. [Bloomberg]

headline.main: On Our Radar: Fracking vs. Drought
